Introduction
The elevation of family planning (FP) on the global stage in 2012 with the launch of FP2020
provided an opportunity to create new approaches for monitoring of FP programs. The need for
annual estimates to track progress of the initiative led to the development of standard indicators,
approaches, and methodologies. For countries, having annual estimates of FP indicators was
a priority to better gauge progress towards their own objectives. After the FP2020 initiative
concluded, the
